title: U.S. consumer Christmas spending habits 2011 to 2013
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Responses on X-axis for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents among all 5 Responses and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
Response Spend the same as last Christmas and Do not celebrate Christmas had the biggest gap of 45.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 2013.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Responses on X-axis for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 3 groups, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Responses on X-axis for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents among all 5 Responses and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
Response Spend the same as last Christmas and Do not celebrate Christmas had the biggest gap of 45.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 2013.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 5 different Responses for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013 that are presented on the X-axis.

Response Spend the same as last Christmas had the maximum Share of respondents among all 3 groups, and it was for 2013. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Response Do not celebrate Christmas for 2011.
Among all the Responses, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
Response Spend the same as last Christmas and Do not celebrate Christmas had the biggest gap of 45.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 2013.
Out of all 3 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents was found in case of 2012.

In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0. The second highest Share of respondents 47.0 was observed for 2013 in Response Spend the same as last Christmas.

On average, the Response Spend the same as last Christmas had the highest Share of respondents for all 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013. Whereas Do not celebrate Christmas had the lowest average Share of respondents.

data.Response: Spend the same as last Christmas
